Days before the shooting, the township bought the shooter's property in a sheriff's sale for $1,806.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Members of the township supervisor council and attendees
properties.type_of_gun___detailed: Ruger Mini 14 .223 semi-automatic rifle,  0.44 Magnum revolver
properties.description: On August 5, 2013, an unemployed 59-year old man went to Ross Township's monthly meeting in Salisbury, Pennsylvania, killing three people and injuring four more. The shooter was later restrained and shot in the leg by civilians at the scene. He had been forced to vacate his property of 20 years and had been living out of his car and in abandoned buildings ever since.
properties.title: Ross Township Supervisor Council Meeting

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: The shooter had been diagnosed as schizophrenic and had a 19-year mental health history. He often talked to himself or spoke about previous lives.
properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter was obsessed with actress Selena Gomez and stated that his family members were "preventing him from being with his one true love".
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Mother, sister and her two children
properties.description: On August 14, 2013, a 40-year old man obsessed with actress Selena Gomez, fatally shot his mother, sister, niece and infant nephew. He was later arrested and told police he had to getaway from his family because they were preventing him from being with his one true love.
properties.title: Oklahoma City Residence

properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooters were arguing with a crowd outside of a club, which prompted them to retrieve arms from their car for the attack.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Patrons outside of a club
properties.description: On the evening of March 23, 2014, the shooters were arguing with a crowd outside of a club, which prompted them to retrieve arms from their car for the attack. Eight people were wounded by the attack, and there were no fatalities. The shooters were later apprehended.
properties.title: San Francisco Tenderloin

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: There are multiple indicators that the shooter held a delusional belief that he was being controlled or influenced by extremely low frequency (ELF) electromagnetic waves. The etching of ?My ELF weapon!? on the left side of the receiver of the Remington 870 shotgun is believed to reference these electromagnetic waves. In addition, a document retrieved from his electronic media stated, ?Ultra low frequency attack is what I?ve been subject to for the last 3 months, and to be perfectly honest that is what has driven me to this.? A month before the shooting, the shooter called the police in Rhode Island to complain that he had changed hotels three times because he was being pursued by people keeping him awake by sending vibrations through the walls. He had sought treatment from the Veterans Affairs Department for psychiatric issues.
properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter is said to have delusional theories. Mental illness is a possible motive. According to investigators, the shooter was clearly depressed, and he was also delusional. The story of his complaining that microwaves were being sent through the hotel ceiling to keep him awake is a story of someone with escalating psychosis. The story of his fight at the airport in Virginia, where he accused a woman he didn?t know of laughing at him, reflects acute symptomatic paranoia.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Military and coworkers at the Navy Yar. According to the FBI, there is no indication to date that the shooter was targeting specific individuals.
properties.description: On September 16, 2013, a 34-yearl old contractor for the Navy Yard in Washington D.C, entered the building shooting randomly, killing twelve people and injuring three surviving victims before he was shot and killed by law enforcement officers.  Five other people were injured during the incident while trying to escape.
properties.title: Washington Navy Yard

properties.possible_motive___detailed: The student had been teased at school and was working through a speech problem that he had. Some students said that  they believe he was bullied. His father had pleaded guilty to misdemeanor child abuse charges after admitting hitting his son in January 2012.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: The shooter shot two students and teacher
properties.description: On October 21, 2013, a 12-year old student at Sparks Middle School in Nevada, shot and injured two students and killed a teacher before killing himself.
properties.title: Sparks Middle School

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: The shooter had used LSD during his years at MIT and had psychotic reaction to his intoxications that left him paranoid with "irreversible brain damage".
properties.possible_motive___detailed: The father of the victim described his son as a religious fanatic who believed that he had seen the devil and that Christ was an imposter, "the devil incarnate". He blamed his son's LSD use on the shootings.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: The shooter killed the caretaker of the church and wounded four other people outside the church.
properties.description: On November 11, 1971, a former MIT student entered St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church on the Gonzaga University campus. The shooter killed the caretaker and wounded four more people before he was killed by police.
properties.title: St. Aloysius Church

properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooters planned the attack to steal money, golden religious icons, and other items of value from the temple.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: A temple abbot, five monks, an apprentice monk, a nun and her nephew
properties.description: On the evening on August 9, 1991, two high school students in the Air Force ROTC program entered a Buddhist monastery intending to steal cameras, golden religious paraphernalia and cash from the monks. After looting the monastery and holding the monks hostage, the boys decided to shoot and kill all nine occupants of the house to leave no witnesses of their crime.
properties.title: Wat Promkunaram Buddhist Temple

properties.possible_motive___detailed: The ex-husband had a history of spousal abuse and weapons violations, and apparently was irate over the divorce. He had made some threats the previous week to his ex-wife. The day of the shooting he was due in court for failing to pay child support. The shooter was sentenced previously that year to nine months probation. He also had a history of drunken driving and weapons charges.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Ex-wife, son, civilian in pursue of the shooter, policemen
properties.description: On February 24, 2005, a 43-year old man opened fire on his ex-wife and son in front of the Smith County Courthouse inTyler, Texas. After wounding three law enforcement officers and killing another civilian, the gunman was killed in a gun battle with officers. The shooter was being sued for unpaid child support.
properties.title: Tyler Courthouse

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: The shooter had no history of being treated for mental illness, though police said acquaintances describe him as having compulsive habits and being set in his ways.
properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter's motive remains unknown. Police said the shooter had no money, no job, and was maxed out on his credit cards.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: The shooter was said to have worked with the victims in the car services business he went into and shot and killed 2 other people. He was also acquainted with the victims in the barber shop, as a former customer.
properties.description: On March 13, 2013, an unemployed 64-year old man set his apartment on fire in Mohawk village, New York, before he went into a local barbershop and shot four people, killing two and wounding two others. Afterwards, the shooter drove to Herkimer village, where he shot and killed to other people at a local car servicing business. After the rampage, he holed up in an abandoned building where he had a standoff with police for 18 hours until he was shot and killed.
properties.title: Mohawk and Herkimer Villages in New York

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: A few days before the incident, the shooter had talked about taking his own life.
properties.possible_motive___detailed: A federal law enforcement official said the shooter had material expressing anti-government and anti-TSA sentiment. The shooter was carrying a note stating that he wanted to kill TSA agents and "instill fear into their traitorous minds".
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Transportation Security Administration (TSA) officers
properties.description: On November 1, 2013, an unemployed 23-year old man entered Terminal 3 at Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) in California, and pulled a rifle from his bag, killing one TSA officer and wounding two other officers and a passenger before he was wounded and captured. Witnesses said that the shooter was calmly asking people: "Hey, are you TSA?". If they said no, the shooter moved on.
properties.title: Los Angeles International Airport (LAX)

properties.possible_motive___detailed: Court records show that his wife filed from divorce in 2011 and at the time of the shooting the order was still pending. In February of 2011, a judge granted his ex-wife a protective order for one year, stating that the ?court finds family violence has occurred and is likely to occur in the future.? The shooter was previously arrested for violating the protective order and evading arrest.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Ex-wife, ex-girlfriend, and their families
properties.description: On August 7, 2013, a 44-year old former special education teacher allegedly went on a murder spree in the Dallas area, killing four people, including his ex-wife and estranged girlfriend, and wounding four others. Once police arrived at the second home, the shooter after running out of ammunition, reportedly pretended he was one of the victims and appeared catatonic.
properties.title: Homes in Desoto and Dallas

properties.possible_motive___detailed: Shooter became upset when his advances on one of the victims was rejected.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Four friends that were at a Hookah bar
properties.description: Altercation in a hookah bar led a group of seven people to leave in a mini-van. They were followed. When the car stopped, the shooter fired upon the car. Four of the seven sustained non-life-threatening injuries.
properties.title: Roswell, GA Hookah shootout

properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter and victim apparently had an ongoing conflict, and the shooter a brief appearance in the victim's music video. The victim, a local rapper, had a lot of community support, and some acquaintances of the shooter suggest that he may have been jealous of the rapper.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: The shooter had participated in a music video created by the rapper who was shot and killed.
properties.description: Early morning on December 28, 2013, a rapper had a confrontation with an acquaintance before going onstage. Soon after, the acquaintance left and re-entered the building and fired at the rapper. He and another shooter injured 5 and killed 3, including the rapper.
properties.title: Centennial Hill Bar & Grill

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: The shooter was being treated for depression and anxiety prior to shooting at Fort Hood. He was awaiting diagnosis for post-traumatic stress disorder at the time of his death.
properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter was experiencing outbreaks from his mental health issues and had gotten into an argument with a superior when he had requested leave.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Military personnel, soldiers, hospital employees
properties.description: On April 2, 2014, a 34-year-old Army Specialist began shooting at Fort Hood where he was stationed. He killed 3 military personnel and wounded 16 others before committing suicide.
properties.title: Fort Hood

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: The shooter had been sent to psychological treatment since the age of nine. After the age of eighteen, the shooter began to shun psychotherapy and seized taking medication. His family believe that he was suffering from Asperger's Syndrome.
properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter was suffering from mental illness, which triggered violent thoughts and behavior after failures with social and sexual relationships that he was unable to obtain
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Two roommates and a friend of the roommates, members of Alpha Phi and Delta Delta sororities, Isla Vista residents and UC Santa Barbara students
properties.description: On the evening of May 23, 2014, a 22-year-old student and resident of Isla Vista stabbed two roommates and their friend to death in his apartment. He then drove to a sorority house in Isla Vista and attempted to enter the premises to no avail, and began shooting at a neighboring sorority's members, killing two and wounding another. He continued shooting between altercations with police throughout Isla Vista, killing another male student and wounding six more before committing suicide.
properties.title: Isla Vista

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: The shooter had been diagnosed with obsessive-compulsive disorder and transient psychosis, for which he had been prescribed medication.
properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter appears to have been taking medication for mental health issues and was suffering from depression. At the time of the shooting, the shooter had ceased to take his prescribed medication.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: One male student was killed, one male and one female student were injured
properties.description: On June 5, 2014, a 26-year-old man entered a hall on the campus of Seattle Pacific University and began shooting at students. The shooter killed one student and injured two others before a student tackled and stopped the shooter as he was reloading.
properties.title: Seattle Pacific University

properties.possible_motive___detailed: Social dispute
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Five innocent people were injured.
properties.description: Two groups of people were asked to leave a nightclub when they started arguing. They were outside the club when they started shooting. Five people were injured.
properties.title: Atlanta Nightclub shooting

properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooters held anti-government beliefs, which lead them to choose police officers as their victims. The third victim was an armed civilian that attempted to stop the shooters.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Two police officers, armed citizen trying to stop shooters
properties.description: On the afternoon of June 8, 2014, a man and his wife approached two police officers having lunch in Las Vegas and began shooting, killing them both. The couple then fled to Walmart, where they killed an armed civilian attempting to stop the shooters. The man was killed by police and the woman killed herself at the Walmart.
properties.title: Nellis Plaza

properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter's attorney claims that he shot in self-defense when an unidentified man began shooting at a group of the defendant's friends.
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: One bystander dead and nine injured at the scene
properties.shooter_name:
Trung Le, 
The second gunman has not been identified.
properties.description: On June 29, 2014, two men were having an argument on Bourbon Street, which escalated into a gunfight. Many shots were fired into the surrounding crowd, killing one and injuring nine.
properties.title: Bourbon Street New Orleans

properties.possible_motive___detailed: The shooter may have been jealous of his ex-girlfriend's new relationship, and angry with her. Apparently the shooter had spoken on the phone with the victim shortly before the shooting and heard the victim's new boyfriend's voice in the background. He sent the victim text messages saying "you tell that (expletive) I'm going to go for him" and "u stupid (expletive) u answered your phone and I heard"
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: The shooter's ex-girlfriend
properties.description: The shooter pulled up to an auto shop and saw his ex-girlfriend talking with her current boyfriend. He crashed his car into the car the couple was standing next to. This knocked the current boyfriend to the ground. The shooter then fired fatal shots at his ex-girlfriend, and shot and injured three other women who had entered the shop.
properties.title: Albuquerque Auto Shop

properties.possible_motive___detailed:
Earlier in the week the shooter sent several text messages to one of the girls he killed including "I hate that I can't live without you," "You can't make a bond with anyone like the bond me and you have right now," and "It won't last." That girl is said to have been the girlfriend of one of the boys the shooter killed. Law enforcement officials suspect that a romantic relationship between the shooter and this girl may have played a role in the motive, but that is unconfirmed.
(The report said the shooter's motive remains unclear, but classmates told police his girlfriend had broken up with him the day before and he had recently been in a fight with a football player over alleged "racial" comments.)
properties.targeted_victim_s___detailed: Five fellow students including 2 cousins and a girl with whom he may have pursued a romantic relationship
properties.description: On October 24, 2014, a freshman at Marysville-Pilchuck High School approached a table of his friends in the school cafeteria and a verbal fight ensued. The student then pulled out a handgun and fired at the students at the table. He injured five students, killed 1 girl, and then committed suicide by shooting himself in the head. Three of the four injured students died in the hospital in the following days.
properties.title: Marysville-Pilchuck High School

properties.history_of_mental_illness___detailed: The shooter had been struggling with financial and relationship issues in the months leading up to the shooting. He considered himself a "targeted individual." In September, the shooter called police saying that he heard voices coming through the walls talking about him and his present activities. In October, he was hospitalized for mental health.

Police believe he believed he was targeted by the government.
